Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

content_list.content:
Here are the three requested CSV files based on the provided domain model for a software development company using SCRUM. The entries are derived from the entities and relationships, following the specified conventions.

---

### **Goals.csv**
```csv

G0,maximize_project_budget,Maximize the total budget allocated across all projects,True,max,Project,budget,2,1.5
G1,maximize_team_size,Maximize the average size of development teams,True,max,Team,team_size,1,1.0
G2,maximize_worker_availability,Maximize the number of fully available workers,True,max,Worker,availability,2,1.2

G4,maximize_story_points,Maximize the total story points completed,True,max,UserStory,story_points,2,1.3
G5,minimize_sprint_duration,Minimize the average duration of sprints,False,min,Sprint,end_date,0,0.8

Goals represent objectives, Conditions represent constraints or filters, and DecisionVariables represent tunable or assignable values in the system.

f860856b-8228-4b74-95bb-1e6e3d23ab23.content:
Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"
The items of each category are itemized between \begin and \end.
Goals and Conditions show both their IDs, Names and the logical and mathematical representation

content_list.content:
Here is the complete LaTeX `.tex` file code that incorporates all previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) into a structured optimization model document. The document includes a title page, table of contents, and five sections with itemized content. Goals and Conditions include both IDs, names, and their logical/mathematical formulations.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath}
\usepackage{amssymb}
\usepackage{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}
\usepackage{hyperref}
\usepackage{enumitem}

\geometry{a4paper, margin=1in}
\titleformat{\section}{\large\bfseries}{}{0em}{}[\titlerule]
\titleformat{\subsection}{\bfseries}{}{0em}{}

\title{\Huge Optimization Model for SCRUM-Based Software Development \\ \Large Domain-Driven Mathematical Formulation}
\author{\Large AI Assistant}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ \{ p \mid p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ \{ t \mid t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ \{ w \mid w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ \{ f \mid f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ \{ s \mid s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ \{ r \mid r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ \{ po \mid po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ \{ sm \mid sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ \{ pb \mid pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ \{ sp \mid sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SPP} $: Set of Sprint Plannings $ \{ spp \mid spp \in \text{SprintPlanning} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DS} $: Set of Daily Scrums $ \{ ds \mid ds \in \text{DailyScrum} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SR} $: Set of Sprint Reviews $ \{ sr \mid sr \in \text{SprintReview} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SRE} $: Set of Sprint Retrospectives $ \{ sre \mid sre \in \text{SprintRetrospective} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SBL} $: Set of Sprint Backlogs $ \{ sbl \mid sbl \in \text{SprintBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SG} $: Set of Sprint Goals $ \{ sg \mid sg \in \text{SprintGoal} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{E} $: Set of Epics $ \{ e \mid e \in \text{Epic} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ \{ us \mid us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ \{ tsk \mid tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ \{ dev \mid dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ \{ bl \mid bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ \{ sh \mid sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ \{ vel \mid vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ \{ rep \mid rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ \{ rm \mid rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SCB} $: Set of Scrum Boards $ \{ scb \mid scb \in \text{ScrumBoard} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ \{ fed \mid fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for projects
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for teams
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for workers
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for features
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for skills
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for roles
    \item $ po \in \mathcal{PO} $: Index for product owners
    \item $ sm \in \mathcal{SM} $: Index for scrum masters
    \item $ pb \in \mathcal{PB} $: Index for product backlogs
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for sprints
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for user stories
    \item $ e \in \mathcal{E} $: Index for epics
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for tasks
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for blockers
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for stakeholders
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for velocity records
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for release plans
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for roadmaps
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_project\_budget} \\
    Maximize total project budget: 
    \[
    \max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{budget}_p \quad \text{(Weight: 1.5)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G1: maximize\_team\_size} \\
    Maximize total team size:
    \[
    \max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \text{team\_size}_t \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_worker\_availability} \\
    Maximize available workers:
    \[
    \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \mathbb{I}(\text{availability}_w = \text{full}) \quad \text{(Weight: 1.2)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_task\_effort} \\
    Minimize total effort per task:
    \[
    \min \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} \text{effort}_{tsk} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.9)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_story\_points} \\
    Maximize completed story points:
    \[
    \max \sum_{us \in \mathcal{US}} \text{story\_points}_{us} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.3)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Minimize average sprint duration:
    \[
    \min \frac{1}{|\mathcal{SP}|} \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} (\text{end\_date}_{sp} - \text{start\_date}_{sp}) \quad \text{(Weight: 0.8)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend:
    \[
    \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}_{vel} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.4)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G7: maximize\_release\_plan\_included\_features} \\
    Maximize number of features in release:
    \[
    \max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} |\text{included\_features}_{rep}| \quad \text{(Weight: 1.1)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G8: minimize\_epic\_estimated\_effort} \\
    Minimize total epic effort:
    \[
    \min \sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} \text{estimated\_effort}_e \quad \text{(Weight: 0.95)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G9: maximize\_sprint\_achievement\_of\_goal} \\
    Maximize sprint goal success:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{achievement\_of\_goal}_{sp} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.25)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G10: minimize\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Minimize total blocker severity:
    \[
    \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \text{severity}_{bl} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.7)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G11: maximize\_dev\_snapshot\_test\_status} \\
    Maximize successful test status:
    \[
    \max \sum_{dev \in \mathcal{DEV}} \mathbb{I}(\text{test\_status}_{dev} = \text{passed}) \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence\_level} \\
    Maximize stakeholder influence:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}_{sh} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.85)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_daily\_scrum\_duration} \\
    Minimize daily scrum time:
    \[
    \min \sum_{ds \in \mathcal{DS}} \text{duration}_{ds} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.75)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_sprint\_retro\_improvement\_actions} \\
    Maximize improvement actions:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sre \in \mathcal{SRE}} |\text{improvement\_actions}_{sre}| \quad \text{(Weight: 1.15)}
    \]
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_project\_status\_active} \\
    Only active projects are valid:
    \[
    \forall p \in \mathcal{P}: \text{status}_p = \text{active} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C1: require\_team\_status\_active} \\
    Only active teams:
    \[
    \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{team\_status}_t = \text{active} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C2: require\_worker\_status\_active} \\
    Only active workers:
    \[
    \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{status}_w = \text{active} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.9)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_user\_story\_status\_done} \\
    Count only completed stories:
    \[
    \forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{status}_{us} = \text{done} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.2)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C4: require\_task\_status\_done} \\
    Consider only completed tasks:
    \[
    \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}_{tsk} = \text{done} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.1)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_sprint\_status\_completed} \\
    Only completed sprints:
    \[
    \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}_{sp} = \text{completed} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.3)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C6: require\_blocker\_status\_resolved} \\
    Blockers must be resolved:
    \[
    \forall bl \in \mathcal{BL}: \text{status}_{bl} \neq \text{open} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.8)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_skill\_certified} \\
    Only certified skills:
    \[
    \forall s \in \mathcal{S}: \text{certified}_s = \text{true} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_role\_assigned} \\
    Each worker has at least one role:
    \[
    \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \exists r \in \mathcal{R} \text{ such that } (w,r) \in \text{takes\_on\_role} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.9)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_product\_backlog\_status\_open} \\
    Backlog must be modifiable:
    \[
    \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{status}_{pb} = \text{open} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.05)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C10: require\_scrum\_board\_updated\_recently} \\
    Board updated within 24h:
    \[
    \forall scb \in \mathcal{SCB}: \text{last\_updated}_{scb} \geq \text{now} - 24\text{h} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.7)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_feature\_priority\_high} \\
    Only high-priority features:
    \[
    \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{priority}_f = \text{high} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.15)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_epic\_status\_in\_progress} \\
    Only in-progress epics:
    \[
    \forall e \in \mathcal{E}: \text{status}_e = \text{in progress} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_stakeholder\_relevance\_high} \\
    High relevance stakeholders:
    \[
    \forall sh \in \mathcal{SH}: \text{relevance\_to\_feature}_{sh} = \text{high} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.95)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C14: require\_velocity\_trend\_positive} \\
    Only teams with positive trend:
    \[
    \forall vel \in \mathcal{VEL}: \text{trend}_{vel} > 0 \quad \text{(Weight: 1.2)}
    \]
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \text{assign\_worker\_to\_team}_{w,t} \in \{0,1\} $: 1 if worker $ w $ is assigned to team $ t $, else 0.
    \item $ \text{select\_sprint\_goal}_{sp} \in \mathcal{SG} $: Goal selected for sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ \text{estimate\_task\_effort}_{tsk} \in [0.0, 40.0] $: Estimated effort (in hours) for task $ tsk $.
    \item $ \text{prioritize\_feature}_f \in \{1,2,3\} $: Priority level (1=low, 3=high) of feature $ f $.
    \item $ \text{plan\_sprint\_duration}_{sp} \in [5, 30] $: Duration (in days) of sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ \text{allocate\_budget\_to\_project}_p \in [1000.0, 1000000.0] $: Budget (in USD) assigned to project $ p $.
    \item $ \text{schedule\_daily\_scrum}_{sp} \in [0, 2359] $: Time (in HHMM format) of daily scrum during sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ \text{define\_story\_points}_{us} \in \{1,2,3,5,8,13\} $: Story points assigned to user story $ us $.
    \item $ \text{set\_team\_size}_t \in [3, 12] $: Number of members in team $ t $.
    \item $ \text{choose\_release\_version}_{rep} \in [1.0, 5.0] $: Version number for release plan $ rep $.
    \item $ \text{adjust\_velocity\_input}_t \in [0.0, 100.0] $: Input velocity (story points/sprint) for team $ t $.
    \item $ \text{mark\_blocker\_resolved}_{bl} \in \{0,1\} $: 1 if blocker $ bl $ is resolved, else 0.
    \item $ \text{set\_user\_story\_acceptance\_criteria}_{us} \in [1, 10] $: Number of acceptance criteria for user story $ us $.
    \item $ \text{define\_roadmap\_milestone\_count}_{rm} \in [1, 20] $: Number of milestones in roadmap $ rm $.
    \item $ \text{configure\_scrum\_board\_columns}_{scb} \in [3, 7] $: Number of workflow columns on scrum board $ scb $.
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

---

### âœ… Notes:
- This LaTeX document is ready to compile using any LaTeX engine (e.g., pdflatex, xelatex).
- It includes proper mathematical notation, logical conditions, and references to all entities and decision variables.
- Weights from the `Goals.csv` and `Conditions.csv` are included as annotations.
- Indicator functions ($\mathbb{I}$) are used where discrete conditions apply.
- The model supports integration into optimization frameworks (e.g., MILP, constraint programming).

Let me know if you'd like a version with color coding, hyperlinked TOC, or export to PDF.

Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

messages.content:
Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"
The items of each category are itemized between \begin and \end.
Goals and Conditions show both their IDs, Names and the logical and mathematical representation

content_list.content:
Here is the complete LaTeX `.tex` file code that incorporates all previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) into a structured optimization model document. The document includes a title page, table of contents, and five sections with itemized content. Goals and Conditions include both IDs, names, and their logical/mathematical formulations.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath}
\usepackage{amssymb}
\usepackage{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}
\usepackage{hyperref}
\usepackage{enumitem}

\geometry{a4paper, margin=1in}
\titleformat{\section}{\large\bfseries}{}{0em}{}[\titlerule]
\titleformat{\subsection}{\bfseries}{}{0em}{}

\title{\Huge Optimization Model for SCRUM-Based Software Development \\ \Large Domain-Driven Mathematical Formulation}
\author{\Large AI Assistant}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ \{ p \mid p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ \{ t \mid t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ \{ w \mid w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ \{ f \mid f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ \{ s \mid s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ \{ r \mid r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ \{ po \mid po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ \{ sm \mid sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ \{ pb \mid pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ \{ sp \mid sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SPP} $: Set of Sprint Plannings $ \{ spp \mid spp \in \text{SprintPlanning} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DS} $: Set of Daily Scrums $ \{ ds \mid ds \in \text{DailyScrum} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SR} $: Set of Sprint Reviews $ \{ sr \mid sr \in \text{SprintReview} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SRE} $: Set of Sprint Retrospectives $ \{ sre \mid sre \in \text{SprintRetrospective} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SBL} $: Set of Sprint Backlogs $ \{ sbl \mid sbl \in \text{SprintBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SG} $: Set of Sprint Goals $ \{ sg \mid sg \in \text{SprintGoal} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{E} $: Set of Epics $ \{ e \mid e \in \text{Epic} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ \{ us \mid us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ \{ tsk \mid tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ \{ dev \mid dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ \{ bl \mid bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ \{ sh \mid sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ \{ vel \mid vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ \{ rep \mid rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ \{ rm \mid rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SCB} $: Set of Scrum Boards $ \{ scb \mid scb \in \text{ScrumBoard} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ \{ fed \mid fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for projects
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for teams
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for workers
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for features
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for skills
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for roles
    \item $ po \in \mathcal{PO} $: Index for product owners
    \item $ sm \in \mathcal{SM} $: Index for scrum masters
    \item $ pb \in \mathcal{PB} $: Index for product backlogs
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for sprints
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for user stories
    \item $ e \in \mathcal{E} $: Index for epics
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for tasks
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for blockers
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for stakeholders
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for velocity records
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for release plans
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for roadmaps
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_project\_budget} \\
    Maximize total project budget: 
    \[
    \max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{budget}_p \quad \text{(Weight: 1.5)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G1: maximize\_team\_size} \\
    Maximize total team size:
    \[
    \max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \text{team\_size}_t \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_worker\_availability} \\
    Maximize available workers:
    \[
    \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \mathbb{I}(\text{availability}_w = \text{full}) \quad \text{(Weight: 1.2)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_task\_effort} \\
    Minimize total effort per task:
    \[
    \min \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} \text{effort}_{tsk} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.9)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_story\_points} \\
    Maximize completed story points:
    \[
    \max \sum_{us \in \mathcal{US}} \text{story\_points}_{us} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.3)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Minimize average sprint duration:
    \[
    \min \frac{1}{|\mathcal{SP}|} \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} (\text{end\_date}_{sp} - \text{start\_date}_{sp}) \quad \text{(Weight: 0.8)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend:
    \[
    \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}_{vel} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.4)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G7: maximize\_release\_plan\_included\_features} \\
    Maximize number of features in release:
    \[
    \max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} |\text{included\_features}_{rep}| \quad \text{(Weight: 1.1)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G8: minimize\_epic\_estimated\_effort} \\
    Minimize total epic effort:
    \[
    \min \sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} \text{estimated\_effort}_e \quad \text{(Weight: 0.95)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G9: maximize\_sprint\_achievement\_of\_goal} \\
    Maximize sprint goal success:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{achievement\_of\_goal}_{sp} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.25)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G10: minimize\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Minimize total blocker severity:
    \[
    \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \text{severity}_{bl} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.7)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G11: maximize\_dev\_snapshot\_test\_status} \\
    Maximize successful test status:
    \[
    \max \sum_{dev \in \mathcal{DEV}} \mathbb{I}(\text{test\_status}_{dev} = \text{passed}) \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence\_level} \\
    Maximize stakeholder influence:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}_{sh} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.85)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_daily\_scrum\_duration} \\
    Minimize daily scrum time:
    \[
    \min \sum_{ds \in \mathcal{DS}} \text{duration}_{ds} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.75)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_sprint\_retro\_improvement\_actions} \\
    Maximize improvement actions:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sre \in \mathcal{SRE}} |\text{improvement\_actions}_{sre}| \quad \text{(Weight: 1.15)}
    \]
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_project\_status\_active} \\
    Only active projects are valid:
    \[
    \forall p \in \mathcal{P}: \text{status}_p = \text{active} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C1: require\_team\_status\_active} \\
    Only active teams:
    \[
    \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{team\_status}_t = \text{active} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C2: require\_worker\_status\_active} \\
    Only active workers:
    \[
    \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{status}_w = \text{active} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.9)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_user\_story\_status\_done} \\
    Count only completed stories:
    \[
    \forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{status}_{us} = \text{done} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.2)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C4: require\_task\_status\_done} \\
    Consider only completed tasks:
    \[
    \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}_{tsk} = \text{done} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.1)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_sprint\_status\_completed} \\
    Only completed sprints:
    \[
    \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}_{sp} = \text{completed} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.3)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C6: require\_blocker\_status\_resolved} \\
    Blockers must be resolved:
    \[
    \forall bl \in \mathcal{BL}: \text{status}_{bl} \neq \text{open} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.8)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_skill\_certified} \\
    Only certified skills:
    \[
    \forall s \in \mathcal{S}: \text{certified}_s = \text{true} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_role\_assigned} \\
    Each worker has at least one role:
    \[
    \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \exists r \in \mathcal{R} \text{ such that } (w,r) \in \text{takes\_on\_role} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.9)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_product\_backlog\_status\_open} \\
    Backlog must be modifiable:
    \[
    \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{status}_{pb} = \text{open} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.05)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C10: require\_scrum\_board\_updated\_recently} \\
    Board updated within 24h:
    \[
    \forall scb \in \mathcal{SCB}: \text{last\_updated}_{scb} \geq \text{now} - 24\text{h} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.7)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_feature\_priority\_high} \\
    Only high-priority features:
    \[
    \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{priority}_f = \text{high} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.15)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_epic\_status\_in\_progress} \\
    Only in-progress epics:
    \[
    \forall e \in \mathcal{E}: \text{status}_e = \text{in progress} \quad \text{(Weight: 1.0)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_stakeholder\_relevance\_high} \\
    High relevance stakeholders:
    \[
    \forall sh \in \mathcal{SH}: \text{relevance\_to\_feature}_{sh} = \text{high} \quad \text{(Weight: 0.95)}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C14: require\_velocity\_trend\_positive} \\
    Only teams with positive trend:
    \[
    \forall vel \in \mathcal{VEL}: \text{trend}_{vel} > 0 \quad \text{(Weight: 1.2)}
    \]
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \text{assign\_worker\_to\_team}_{w,t} \in \{0,1\} $: 1 if worker $ w $ is assigned to team $ t $, else 0.
    \item $ \text{select\_sprint\_goal}_{sp} \in \mathcal{SG} $: Goal selected for sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ \text{estimate\_task\_effort}_{tsk} \in [0.0, 40.0] $: Estimated effort (in hours) for task $ tsk $.
    \item $ \text{prioritize\_feature}_f \in \{1,2,3\} $: Priority level (1=low, 3=high) of feature $ f $.
    \item $ \text{plan\_sprint\_duration}_{sp} \in [5, 30] $: Duration (in days) of sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ \text{allocate\_budget\_to\_project}_p \in [1000.0, 1000000.0] $: Budget (in USD) assigned to project $ p $.
    \item $ \text{schedule\_daily\_scrum}_{sp} \in [0, 2359] $: Time (in HHMM format) of daily scrum during sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ \text{define\_story\_points}_{us} \in \{1,2,3,5,8,13\} $: Story points assigned to user story $ us $.
    \item $ \text{set\_team\_size}_t \in [3, 12] $: Number of members in team $ t $.
    \item $ \text{choose\_release\_version}_{rep} \in [1.0, 5.0] $: Version number for release plan $ rep $.
    \item $ \text{adjust\_velocity\_input}_t \in [0.0, 100.0] $: Input velocity (story points/sprint) for team $ t $.
    \item $ \text{mark\_blocker\_resolved}_{bl} \in \{0,1\} $: 1 if blocker $ bl $ is resolved, else 0.
    \item $ \text{set\_user\_story\_acceptance\_criteria}_{us} \in [1, 10] $: Number of acceptance criteria for user story $ us $.
    \item $ \text{define\_roadmap\_milestone\_count}_{rm} \in [1, 20] $: Number of milestones in roadmap $ rm $.
    \item $ \text{configure\_scrum\_board\_columns}_{scb} \in [3, 7] $: Number of workflow columns on scrum board $ scb $.
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

- This LaTeX document is ready to compile using any LaTeX engine (e.g., pdflatex, xelatex).

Transform all of the provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Attributes, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) into a graph using the Mermaid.js Live Editor graph TD syntax.
Connect...

Colorize...

- Relations in orange
- Goals in green
- Conditions in red
- Decision Variables in purple
